com.azure.storage.file

Class FileAsyncClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.azure.storage.file.FileAsyncClient

  • public class FileAsyncClient
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a client that contains all the operations for interacting with file in Azure Storage File Service. Operations allowed by the client are creating, copying, uploading, downloading, deleting and listing on a file, retrieving properties, setting metadata and list or force close handles of the file.

    Instantiating an Asynchronous File Client

    FileAsyncClient client = new FileClientBuilder()
    .connectionString("${connectionString}")
    .endpoint("${endpoint}")
    .buildAsyncClient();

    View this for additional ways to construct the client.

    See Also:
    FileClientBuilder, FileClient, SharedKeyCredential, SASTokenCredential

      • getFileUrl

        public java.net.URL getFileUrl()
        Get the url of the storage file client.

        the URL of the storage file client
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the file is using a malformed URL.

      • create

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<FileInfo>> create(long maxSize)
        Creates a file in the storage account and returns a response of FileInfo to interact with it.

        Code Samples

        Create the file with size 1KB.

        Response<FileInfo> response = fileClient.create(1024);
System.out.println("Complete creating the file with status code: " + response.statusCode());

        For more information, see the Azure Docs.

        Parameters:
        maxSize - The maximum size in bytes for the file, up to 1 TiB.
        Returns:
        A response containing the file info and the status of creating the file.
        Throws:
        StorageErrorException - If the file has already existed, the parent directory does not exist or fileName is an invalid resource name.

      • create

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<FileInfo>> create(long maxSize,
                                                              FileHTTPHeaders httpHeaders,
                                                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata)
        Creates a file in the storage account and returns a response of FileInfo to interact with it.

        Code Samples

        Create the file with length of 1024 bytes, some headers and metadata.

        FileHTTPHeaders httpHeaders = new FileHTTPHeaders().fileContentType("text/plain");
fileAsyncClient.create(1024, httpHeaders, Collections.singletonMap("file", "updatedMetadata"))
    .subscribe(response -> System.out.printf("Creating the file completed with status code %d",
        response.statusCode()));

        For more information, see the Azure Docs.

        Parameters:
        maxSize - The maximum size in bytes for the file, up to 1 TiB.
        httpHeaders - Additional parameters for the operation.
        metadata - Optional name-value pairs associated with the file as metadata. Metadata names must adhere to the naming rules.
        Returns:
        A response containing the directory info and the status of creating the directory.
        Throws:
        StorageErrorException - If the directory has already existed, the parent directory does not exist or directory is an invalid resource name.
        See Also:
        C# identifiers

      • startCopy

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<FileCopyInfo>> startCopy(java.lang.String sourceUrl,
                                                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata)
        Copies a blob or file to a destination file within the storage account.

        Code Samples

        Copy file from source url to the filePath 

        fileAsyncClient.startCopy("https://{accountName}.file.core.windows.net?{SASToken}",
    Collections.singletonMap("file", "metadata")).subscribe(
        response -> System.out.println("Successfully copying the file with status code: " + response.statusCode()),
        error -> System.err.println(error.toString()),
        () -> System.out.println("Complete copying the file.")
);

        For more information, see the Azure Docs.

        Parameters:
        sourceUrl - Specifies the URL of the source file or blob, up to 2 KB in length.
        metadata - Optional name-value pairs associated with the file as metadata. Metadata names must adhere to the naming rules.
        Returns:
        A response containing the file copy info and the status of copying the file.
        See Also:
        C# identifiers

      • abortCopy

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<VoidResponse> abortCopy(java.lang.String copyId)
        Aborts a pending Copy File operation, and leaves a destination file with zero length and full metadata.

        Code Samples

        Abort copy file from copy id("someCopyId") 

        fileAsyncClient.abortCopy("someCopyId")
    .subscribe(response -> System.out.printf("Abort copying the file completed with status code %d",
        response.statusCode()));

        For more information, see the Azure Docs.

        Parameters:
        copyId - Specifies the copy id which has copying pending status associate with it.
        Returns:
        A response containing the status of aborting copy the file.

      • downloadToFile

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<java.lang.Void> downloadToFile(java.lang.String downloadFilePath)
        Downloads a file from the system, including its metadata and properties

        Code Samples

        Download the file to current folder. 

        fileAsyncClient.downloadToFile("somelocalfilepath").subscribe(
    response -> {
        if (Files.exists(Paths.get("somelocalfilepath"))) {
            System.out.println("Successfully downloaded the file.");
        }
    },
    error -> System.err.print(error.toString()),
    () -> System.out.println("Complete downloading the file!")
);

        For more information, see the Azure Docs.

        Parameters:
        downloadFilePath - The path where store the downloaded file
        Returns:
        An empty response.

      • downloadToFile

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<java.lang.Void> downloadToFile(java.lang.String downloadFilePath,
                                                                  FileRange range)
        Downloads a file from the system, including its metadata and properties

        Code Samples

        Download the file from 1024 to 2048 bytes to current folder. 

        fileAsyncClient.downloadToFile("somelocalfilepath", new FileRange(1024, 2047L)).subscribe(
    response -> {
        if (Files.exists(Paths.get("somelocalfilepath"))) {
            System.out.println("Successfully downloaded the file.");
        }
    },
    error -> System.err.print(error.toString()),
    () -> System.out.println("Complete downloading the file!")
);

        For more information, see the Azure Docs.

        Parameters:
        downloadFilePath - The path where store the downloaded file
        range - Optional byte range which returns file data only from the specified range.
        Returns:
        An empty response.

      • downloadWithProperties

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<FileDownloadInfo>> downloadWithProperties()
        Downloads a file from the system, including its metadata and properties

        Code Samples

        Download the file with its metadata and properties. 

        fileAsyncClient.downloadWithProperties().subscribe(
    response -> { },
    error -> System.err.print(error.toString()),
    () -> System.out.println("Complete downloading the data!")
);

        For more information, see the Azure Docs.

        Returns:
        A response that only contains headers and response status code

      • downloadWithProperties

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<FileDownloadInfo>> downloadWithProperties(FileRange range,
                                                                                      java.lang.Boolean rangeGetContentMD5)
        Downloads a file from the system, including its metadata and properties

        Code Samples

        Download the file from 1024 to 2048 bytes with its metadata and properties and without the contentMD5. 

        fileAsyncClient.downloadWithProperties(new FileRange(1024, 2047L), false).subscribe(
    response -> { },
    error -> System.err.print(error.toString()),
    () -> System.out.println("Complete downloading the data!")
);

        For more information, see the Azure Docs.

        Parameters:
        range - Optional byte range which returns file data only from the specified range.
        rangeGetContentMD5 - Optional boolean which the service returns the MD5 hash for the range when it sets to true, as long as the range is less than or equal to 4 MB in size.
        Returns:
        A response that only contains headers and response status code

      • delete

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<VoidResponse> delete()
        Deletes the file associate with the client.

        Code Samples

        Delete the file

        fileAsyncClient.delete().subscribe(
    response -> { },
    error -> System.err.print(error.toString()),
    () -> System.out.println("Complete deleting the file!")
);

        For more information, see the Azure Docs.

        Returns:
        A response that only contains headers and response status code
        Throws:
        StorageErrorException - If the directory doesn't exist or the file doesn't exist.

      • getProperties

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<FileProperties>> getProperties()
        Retrieves the properties of the storage account's file. The properties includes file metadata, last modified date, is server encrypted, and eTag.

        Code Samples

        Retrieve file properties

        fileAsyncClient.getProperties()
    .subscribe(response -> {
        FileProperties properties = response.value();
        System.out.printf("File latest modified date is %s.", properties.lastModified());
    });

        For more information, see the Azure Docs.

        Returns:
        Storage file properties

      • setHttpHeaders

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<FileInfo>> setHttpHeaders(long newFileSize,
                                                                      FileHTTPHeaders httpHeaders)
        Sets the user-defined httpHeaders to associate to the file.

        If null is passed for the httpHeaders it will clear the httpHeaders associated to the file.

        Code Samples

        Set the httpHeaders of contentType of "text/plain"

        FileHTTPHeaders httpHeaders = new FileHTTPHeaders().fileContentType("text/plain");
fileAsyncClient.setHttpHeaders(1024, httpHeaders)
    .subscribe(response -> System.out.printf("Setting the file httpHeaders completed with status code %d",
        response.statusCode()));

        Clear the metadata of the file

        fileAsyncClient.setHttpHeaders(1024, null)
    .subscribe(response -> System.out.printf("Setting the file httpHeaders completed with status code %d",
        response.statusCode()));

        For more information, see the Azure Docs.

        Parameters:
        newFileSize - New file size of the file
        httpHeaders - Resizes a file to the specified size. If the specified byte value is less than the current size of the file, then all ranges above the specified byte value are cleared.
        Returns:
        Response of the information about the file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if parameters fail the validation.

      • setMetadata

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<FileMetadataInfo>> setMetadata(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata)
        Sets the user-defined metadata to associate to the file.

        If null is passed for the metadata it will clear the metadata associated to the file.

        Code Samples

        Set the metadata to "file:updatedMetadata"

        fileAsyncClient.setMetadata(Collections.singletonMap("file", "updatedMetadata"))
    .subscribe(response -> System.out.printf("Setting the file metadata completed with status code %d",
        response.statusCode()));

        Clear the metadata of the file

        fileAsyncClient.setMetadata(null)
    .subscribe(response -> System.out.printf("Setting the file metadata completed with status code %d",
        response.statusCode()));

        For more information, see the Azure Docs.

        Parameters:
        metadata - Options.Metadata to set on the file, if null is passed the metadata for the file is cleared
        Returns:
        information about the file
        Throws:
        StorageErrorException - If the file doesn't exist or the metadata contains invalid keys

      • upload

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<FileUploadInfo>> upload(reactor.core.publisher.Flux<io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf> data,
                                                                    long length)
        Uploads a range of bytes to the beginning of a file in storage file service. Upload operations performs an in-place write on the specified file.

        Code Samples

        Upload "default" to the file. 

        ByteBuf defaultData = Unpooled.wrappedBuffer("default".getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8));
fileAsyncClient.upload(Flux.just(defaultData), defaultData.readableBytes()).subscribe(
    response -> { },
    error -> System.err.print(error.toString()),
    () -> System.out.println("Complete deleting the file!")
);

        For more information, see the Azure Docs.

        Parameters:
        data - The data which will upload to the storage file.
        length - Specifies the number of bytes being transmitted in the request body. When the FileRangeWriteType is set to clear, the value of this header must be set to zero..
        Returns:
        A response that only contains headers and response status code
        Throws:
        StorageErrorException - If you attempt to upload a range that is larger than 4 MB, the service returns status code 413 (Request Entity Too Large)

      • upload

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<FileUploadInfo>> upload(reactor.core.publisher.Flux<io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf> data,
                                                                    long length,
                                                                    long offset,
                                                                    FileRangeWriteType type)
        Uploads a range of bytes to specific of a file in storage file service. Upload operations performs an in-place write on the specified file.

        Code Samples

        Upload the file from 1024 to 2048 bytes with its metadata and properties and without the contentMD5. 

        ByteBuf defaultData = Unpooled.wrappedBuffer("default".getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8));
fileAsyncClient.upload(Flux.just(defaultData), defaultData.readableBytes(), 1024,
    FileRangeWriteType.UPDATE).subscribe(
        response -> { },
        error -> System.err.print(error.toString()),
        () -> System.out.println("Complete deleting the file!")
);

        For more information, see the Azure Docs.

        Parameters:
        data - The data which will upload to the storage file.
        offset - Optional starting point of the upload range. It will start from the beginning if it is null
        length - Specifies the number of bytes being transmitted in the request body. When the FileRangeWriteType is set to clear, the value of this header must be set to zero.
        type - You may specify one of the following options:
        • Update: Writes the bytes specified by the request body into the specified range.
        • Clear: Clears the specified range and releases the space used in storage for that range. To clear a range, set the Content-Length header to zero.
          Returns:
          A response that only contains headers and response status code
          Throws:
          StorageErrorException - If you attempt to upload a range that is larger than 4 MB, the service returns status code 413 (Request Entity Too Large)

        • uploadFromFile

          public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<java.lang.Void> uploadFromFile(java.lang.String uploadFilePath)
          Uploads file to storage file service.

          Code Samples

          Upload the file from the source file path. 

          fileAsyncClient.uploadFromFile("someFilePath").subscribe(
    response -> { },
    error -> System.err.print(error.toString()),
    () -> System.out.println("Complete deleting the file!")
);

          For more information, see the Azure Docs Create File and Azure Docs Upload.

          Parameters:
          uploadFilePath - The path where store the source file to upload
          Returns:
          An empty response.

        • uploadFromFile

          public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<java.lang.Void> uploadFromFile(java.lang.String uploadFilePath,
                                                                  FileRangeWriteType type)
          Uploads file to storage file service.

          Code Samples

          Upload the file from the source file path.

          (@codesnippet com.azure.storage.file.fileAsyncClient.uploadFromFile#string-filerangewritetype}

          For more information, see the Azure Docs Create File and Azure Docs Upload.

          Parameters:
          uploadFilePath - The path where store the source file to upload
          type - You may specify one of the following options:
          • Update: Writes the bytes specified by the request body into the specified range.
          • Clear: Clears the specified range and releases the space used in storage for that range. To clear a range, set the Content-Length header to zero.
            Returns:
            An empty response.
            Throws:
            java.io.UncheckedIOException - If an I/O error occurs.

          • listRanges

            public reactor.core.publisher.Flux<FileRange> listRanges()
            List of valid ranges for a file.

            Code Samples

            List all ranges for the file client.

            fileAsyncClient.listRanges().subscribe(range ->
    System.out.printf("List ranges completed with start: %d, end: %d", range.start(), range.end()));

            For more information, see the Azure Docs.

            Returns:
            ranges in the files.

          • listRanges

            public reactor.core.publisher.Flux<FileRange> listRanges(FileRange range)
            List of valid ranges for a file.

            Code Samples

            List all ranges within the file range from 1KB to 2KB.

            fileAsyncClient.listRanges(new FileRange(1024, 2048L))
    .subscribe(result -> System.out.printf("List ranges completed with start: %d, end: %d",
        result.start(), result.end()));

            For more information, see the Azure Docs.

            Parameters:
            range - Optional byte range which returns file data only from the specified range.
            Returns:
            ranges in the files that satisfy the requirements

            public reactor.core.publisher.Flux<HandleItem> listHandles()

            fileAsyncClient.listHandles()
    .subscribe(result -> System.out.printf("List handles completed with handle id %s", result.handleId()));

            For more information, see the Azure Docs.

            Returns:
            handles in the files that satisfy the requirements

          • listHandles

            public reactor.core.publisher.Flux<HandleItem> listHandles(java.lang.Integer maxResults)
            List of open handles on a file.

            Code Samples

            List 10 handles for the file client.

            fileAsyncClient.listHandles(10)
    .subscribe(result -> System.out.printf("List handles completed with handle id %s", result.handleId()));

            For more information, see the Azure Docs.

            Parameters:
            maxResults - Optional maximum number of results will return per page
            Returns:
            handles in the file that satisfy the requirements

          • forceCloseHandles

            public reactor.core.publisher.Flux<java.lang.Integer> forceCloseHandles(java.lang.String handleId)
            Closes a handle or handles opened on a file at the service. It is intended to be used alongside FileAsyncClient.listHandles() (Integer)} . TODO: Will change the return type to how many handles have been closed. Implement one more API to force close all handles. TODO: @see Github Issue 4525

            Code Samples

            Force close handles with handles returned by list handles in recursive.

            fileAsyncClient.listHandles(10)
    .subscribe(result -> {
        fileAsyncClient.forceCloseHandles(result.handleId()).subscribe(numOfClosedHandles ->
            System.out.printf("Close %d handles.", numOfClosedHandles));
    });

            For more information, see the Azure Docs.

            Parameters:
            handleId - Specifies the handle ID to be closed. Use an asterisk ('*') as a wildcard string to specify all handles.
            Returns:
            The counts of number of handles closed

          • getShareSnapshotId

            public java.lang.String getShareSnapshotId()
            Get snapshot id which attached to FileAsyncClient. Return null if no snapshot id attached.

            Code Samples

            Get the share snapshot id. 

            OffsetDateTime currentTime = OffsetDateTime.of(LocalDateTime.now(), ZoneOffset.UTC);
FileAsyncClient fileAsyncClient = new FileClientBuilder()
    .endpoint("https://${accountName}.file.core.windows.net")
    .credential(SASTokenCredential.fromQuery("${SASToken}"))
    .shareName("myshare")
    .filePath("myfiile")
    .snapshot(currentTime.toString())
    .buildAsyncClient();
fileAsyncClient.getShareSnapshotId();
            Returns:
            The snapshot id which is a unique DateTime value that identifies the share snapshot to its base share.
